abstract: K2 Network, an online game publisher that has been bringing multiplayer Asian games to the United States market, said it won $16 million in a second round of funding led by Intel‘s venture capital arm. The round included new investors Khosla Ventures , Greycroft Ventures and Novel TMT Ventures.
lead_paragraph: K2 Network, an online game publisher that has been bringing multiplayer Asian games to the United States market, said it won $16 million in a second round of funding led by Intel‘s venture capital arm. The round included new investors Khosla Ventures , Greycroft Ventures and Novel TMT Ventures.

headline.main: Intel Gives K2 Network Capital to Play With
